result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert T Wyant

records.addlTxt: Order Appointing Counsel, signed and filed.

Defendant Robert T Wyant appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant appears without counsel. Court held colloquy with defendant.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  
Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  
The court appointed Attorney Amanda Olsen to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant NOT REQUIRED to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees. Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 09-25-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Robert T Wyant in court. Student Intern Madeline Whitty under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 15.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/23/22 @ 2:30p
